item.title: Outside 104 Welch Road - dead tree, 29th September
item.description:
This young rowan/mountain ash started to wilt in summer. I watered it regularly but it appears to have a fungal disease on the trunk and the leaves all withered in late summer. I was hoping it would recover but I think it is dead.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Several Deep potholes, 29th September
item.description:
The first section of road on Athelney way is covered in potholes. These keep getting patched up and last approx six months before opening up again. Junction and road needs resurfacing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Athelney Way, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Middle of the cul de sac, 29th September
item.description:
Cul de sac semi circle back to the pavement, the tarmac road is damaged / sinking (you can see where the line has dropped) due to continuous cars and bin lorries turning in this cul de sac over time. The tarmac has been damaged in the middle of the road leaving holes in the tarmac join. Please repair the tarmac holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horsbere Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree has fallen on pavement in front of 30 Langdon Road. Blocks all pedestrian access/, 29th September
item.description:
At 6.45pm on Sunday 29 September, a tree that was growing out of the pavement fell down, blocking the pavement on the north side of Langond Road. The tree was roughly 20 feet tall, so the blockage of the pavement is total.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
